article_headline: Applications are now being accepted for the
article_text: the second game, dropping a 4-2 extra-inning decision to the Roadrunners. In that contest, Bakersfield started out fast, scoring single runs in the first two innings to take an early lead. The Mustangs answered with single runs in the first and fourth to tie the game at 2-2. In the third inning Cal Poly had three hits, but had runners thrown out at third base and home plate to kill the rally. The game remained tied after the regulation seven innings. In the Roadrunner half of the eighth they combined three hits to score two runs, and took a 4-2 lead. Bakersfield pitcher Margaret Harvey retired the Mustangs in order in the bottom half of the inning to secure the win.
